Articles.Content: I made a colony with starships on duna but when i tried to refuel using surface harvesters and converters i realized that the rocket uses liquid methane. Is there anything i can do to get around this?

Moved to gameplay questions.    
 

While this is normally reserved for unmodded games, it does bring up a good point.    
 

One of the joys of KSP is screwing up and being able to engineer a solution that works.   You could add a mod that changes the fuel or fuel levels, or you could use the cheat menu to add fuel, but where’s the fun in that?    
 

I’m not sure what your actual issue is, as most mods that I know of that add fuels usually add them to the ISRO parts too.   But apparently you can’t make methane.    
 

Then send some!    Build another ship that will ferry the fuel you need to Duna.    Or probably better yet, send a nearly identical ship, but with different engines this time.    
 

But I’d say the best solution would be to find a mod that adds the correct fuels you need to the ISRU parts and that way you have it as designed, and didn’t “cheat”.
